title: Booting to Windows XP Virtual Disk from any platform

forumNotes.author: zumka
forumNotes.content:
Hi,  

We are faced almost on a daily bases with the rolling out company SOE using Norton ghost on to a different hardware laptops and workstations.  
As you can imagine it can be very time consuming.   
Can you please suggest the way to boot to a Windows XP virtual disk (VHD, VDMK or simmilar) from the different hardware platforms.  
For some reasons I can't find a solid solution to this problem, VHD only allows to boot Windows 7 or 2008, VLite Vboot doesn't support windows xp yet, I'm not even sure about VMware and their solutions.   
Please note remote desktop or similar solutions are not the options for us at the moment.  

At the end of the day what we are looking for is bare metal workstation with the ability to boot to virtual disk with Win XP.  

Thank you for your help

forumNotes.author: Sha0
forumNotes.content: Some questions: * What does "SOE" mean? * Did you know that different types of computers require different **HAL** s and **kernel** s, and have different **HDD controller**s? It reads like you are interested in a "universal image." * What is your minimum amount of RAM? * What is your intended boot medium (network, USB, CD/DVD, HDD, etc.)? * Did you know that **MEMDISK** and **GRUB4DOS** support RAM disks from raw HDD images? * Do you have "virtulization technology" on all computer types? Have you read about **KVM+QEmu**?
